Package com.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface LoginAPI

All Superinterfaces:
LoginAPI
@Deprecated(since="9.0", forRemoval=true) public interface LoginAPI extends LoginAPI
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
As multi-tenancy has been removed, this class makes no more sense. Use LoginAPI instead
Author:
Matthieu Chaffotte

  • Method Details

    • login

      @Deprecated(since="9.0", forRemoval=true) APISession login(long tenantId, String userName, String password) throws LoginException, TenantIsPausedException
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      As multi-tenancy has been removed, the tenantId makes no more sense. Use LoginAPI.login(String, String) instead
      Connects the user in order to use API methods of a tenant.
      Parameters:
      tenantId - the tenant identifier
      userName - the user name
      password - the password
      Returns:
      the session to use with other tenant API methods
      Throws:
      LoginException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the login (userName does not exist, or couple (userName, password) is incorrect)
      TenantIsPausedException - if the tenant is paused. No login is allowed for users other than the technical user.
      Since:
      6.0

    • login

      @Deprecated(since="9.0", forRemoval=true) APISession login(long tenantId, Map<String,Serializable> credentials) throws LoginException, TenantIsPausedException
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      As multi-tenancy has been removed, the tenantId makes no more sense. Use LoginAPI.login(Map) instead
      Connects the user in order to use API methods of a tenant.
      Parameters:
      tenantId - the tenant identifier
      credentials - the credentials to login with. Can be username / password, SSO ticket, ... depending on the implementation.
      Returns:
      the session to use with other tenant API methods
      Throws:
      LoginException - occurs when an exception is thrown during the login (userName does not exist, or couple (userName, password) is incorrect)
      TenantIsPausedException - if the tenant is paused. No login is allowed for users other than the technical user.
      Since:
      6.0
